snippet: The president’s request was crafted to soothe Democrats who don’t want another war and assure Republicans that the United States will do what it takes to defeat Islamic State militants.
abstract: Pres Obama, in requesting that Congress authorize three-year military campaign against Islamic State, chooses language carefully aimed at assuaging both Democrats' fears of becoming embroiled in another long-term war and Republican hawks who want to crush militant group.
lead_paragraph: The president’s request was crafted to soothe Democrats who don’t want another war and assure Republicans that the United States will do what it takes to defeat Islamic State militants.
